content.description:
Directly right of

Dike Line

and tucked in between a tree and the

Flash Gordon Boulder

is this poorly named problem that is much more entertaining than the name suggests.

A high-step and a thumb catch are the key to a series of grainy but very positive huecos which lead up and right and then back left to the topout. Somewhat engaging with the tree so close at hand but it never gets in the way and the climbing is very secure. A spotter can be handy for the balancy start but is pointless higher.

This quality problem takes a balancy and somewhat comitting line up the dished face left of

Dike Line

(5.7). Work up and right on edges and dishes to a key right-hand knob pinch and then finish just slightly to the left. A spotter is key to keep you off the boulder at the base should you fall midway.

Not listed in the current guidebook but an obvious and quality problem worth a go if in the area.
content.location:
Left side of the west face, just left of

Dike Line

.

content.description:
Climb the

Dike Line

from a direct start down to the right.

The crux is balancy and comes early before joining the original at mid height.

Climbs a slabby face up to a wide left-slanting dike system just left of the

Flash Gordon Boulder

. A good warm-up for the area and probably about 5.7 in difficulty.

A spotter, to keep one off the small rock at the base, might be a good idea if there's a possibility of coming off.
